info.title: U.S. EPA Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) - Air Pollutant Report Rest Services
info.description:
Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) is a tool developed and maintained by EPA's Office of Enforcement and Compliance Assurance for public use. ECHO provides integrated compliance and enforcement information for about 800,000 regulated facilities nationwide.


The Air Pollutant Report presents ten years of EPA air emissions data from the National Emissions Inventory (NEI), Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program (GHGRP), Toxics Release Inventory (TRI), and Clean Air Markets Programs for a selected facility. Emissions are presented by pollutant for each program and each year that values are available.


Additional ECHO Resources: [Web Services](https://echo.epa.gov/tools/web-services), [About ECHO's Data](https://echo.epa.gov/resources/echo-data/about-the-data), [Data Downloads](https://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads).

contact.name: US EPA, OECA Integration, Targeting and Access Branch

ReferencePoint.title: ReferencePoint
ReferencePoint.example: ENTRANCE POINT OF A FACILITY OR STATION

property.CenterLatitude.title: CenterLatitude
property.CenterLatitude.description: The latitude of the facility in degrees, to four decimal places.

property.CenterLongitude.title: CenterLongitude
property.CenterLongitude.description: The longitude of the facility in degrees, to four decimal places.

property.City.title: City
property.City.description: The name of the city, town, village or other locality, when identifiable, within whose boundaries (the majority of) the facility site is located. This is not always the same as the city used for USPS mail delivery.

property.EPASystem.title: EPASystem
property.EPASystem.description:
The EPA data system in which permit and facility records are kept. EPA's Facility Registry System (FRS) links all program database records (such as permit IDs and IDs facilities use in reporting to EPA) together. The following list describes the individual data systems that are linked to from the detailed facility report: 
* AFS: Air Facility System for Clean Air Act stationary source programs.
* ICP: Integrated Compliance Information System for Clean Water Act programs monitoring National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permits.
* RCR: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information System (RCRAInfo) for tracking the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) programs.
* NCDB: National Compliance Database System for monitoring national performance of the Toxic Substance Control Act (TSCA); the Emergency Planning and Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (EPCRA); the Asbestos Hazard Emergency Response (AHERA); and the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA).
* TRI: Toxics Release Inventory for Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 submissions.
* NEI: National Emissions Inventory database contains information on stationary and mobile sources that emit criteria air pollutants and their precursors, as well as hazardous air pollutants (HAPs). The database includes estimates of annual emissions, by source, of air pollutants in each area of the country, on an annual basis.
* TSCA: Toxic Substances Control Act addressing the production, importation, use, and disposal of specific chemicals.

property.FacilityStatus.title: FacilityStatus
property.FacilityStatus.description:
The Air Program Status is given for each source ID (Operating; Planned; Under construction; Temporarily closed;  Permanently closed; and Seasonal)

For CWA, the Permit Compliance System (PCS) designates a permitted facility as being Active or Inactive. Under the CWA, all facilities discharging pollutants from a point source (e.g., a pipe) to surface waters must have a NPDES permit. For CWA, ICISNPDES designates a permit as Effective, Administratively Continued, Expired, Not Needed, Pending, Retired, or Terminated. RCRA facilities (sites) are designated as Active or Inactive. The following provides RCRA site activity status definitions and explains site activity status designation.

property.ICON.title: ICON
property.ICON.description: Name of each individual icon file within the URL base

property.IconBaseURL.title: IconBaseURL
property.IconBaseURL.description: URL where all the icons are located

property.LAT.title: LAT
property.LAT.description: The latitude of the facility in degrees, to four decimal places

property.LON.title: LON
property.LON.description: The longitude of the facility in degrees, to four decimal places

property.Latitude.title: Latitude
property.Latitude.description: The latitude of the facility or permit holder as maintained in each data system.

property.Latitude83.title: Latitude83
property.Latitude83.description: The latitude of the facility or permit holder as maintained in each data system.

property.Lead2008Area.title: Lead2008Area
property.Lead2008Area.description: If null, the facility is not located in a designated non-attainment area. If populated, the value is the name of the non-attainment area; normally this is a city or county name

property.Longitude.title: Longitude
property.Longitude.description: The longitude of the facility or permit holder as maintained in each data system

property.Longitude83.title: Longitude83
property.Longitude83.description: The longitude of the facility or permit holder as maintained in each data system

property.Message.title: Message
property.Message.description: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing.

property.NAICSDesc.title: NAICS Description
property.NAICSDesc.description: The corresponding description of North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code.

property.NAME.title: NAME
property.NAME.description: For DFR, this is the Facility name. The name corresponds to the TYPE value

property.Ozone8hr1997Area.title: Ozone8hr1997Area
property.Ozone8hr1997Area.description: If null, the facility is not located in a designated non-attainment area. If populated, the value is the name of the non-attainment area; normally this is a city or county name

property.Ozone8hr2008Area.title: Ozone8hr2008Area
property.Ozone8hr2008Area.description: If null, the facility is not located in a designated non-attainment area. If populated, the value is the name of the non-attainment area; normally this is a city or county name

property.PUV.title: PUV
property.PUV.description: Pop up value. Combine with PopUpBaseURL to give the popup for the facility

property.ParticulateMatter1997Area.title: ParticulateMatter1997Area
property.ParticulateMatter1997Area.description: If null, the facility is not located in a designated non-attainment area. If populated, the value is the name of the non-attainment area; normally this is a city or county name

property.ParticulateMatter2006Area.title: ParticulateMatter2006Area
property.ParticulateMatter2006Area.description: If null, the facility is not located in a designated non-attainment area. If populated, the value is the name of the non-attainment area; normally this is a city or county name

property.Pollutant.title: Pollutant
property.Pollutant.description: The name that EPA has selected as its preferred name for a substance (also known as registry name). If the registry name is not available, use the systematic name instead.

property.PopUpBaseURL.title: PopUpBaseURL
property.PopUpBaseURL.description: Combine this URL with the PUC to get popup info

property.Program.title: Program
property.Program.description: The source database for the EPA programs information.

property.RegistryID.title: RegistryID
property.RegistryID.description: An internal 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) tracking number used to tie all facility data together in EPA regulatory program databases.

property.RegistryId.title: RegistryId
property.RegistryId.description: 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) identification number.  FRS uniquely identifies a facility by assigning an identification number (FRS ID), and uses this FRS ID to link together all EPA regulatory program database records

property.State.title: State
property.State.description: The two letter abbreviation that represents the state or state equivalent for the U.S.

property.Statute.title: Statute
property.Statute.description:
The name of the statute associated with each of the permits and identifiers linked to the facility: 
* CAA = the Clean Air Act
* CWA = the Clean Water Act
* RCRA = the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act
* EP313 = the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (also known as the Toxics Release Inventory Program)
* TSCA = the Toxic Substances Control Act
* SDWA = the Safe Drinking Water Act

property.SulfurDioxide2010Area.title: SulfurDioxide2010Area
property.SulfurDioxide2010Area.description: If null, the facility is not located in a designated non-attainment area. If populated, the value is the name of the non-attainment area; normally this is a city or county name

property.TYPE.title: TYPE
property.TYPE.description: For DFR, this is always facility

property.Universe.title: Universe
property.Universe.description:
This field provides further description on type of permit or record for each data system as follows:
* For CAA  = The program office defines each CAA Source ID and the associated permits as being Federally Reportable or Non-Federally Reportable. Under the CAA, federally reportable sources include majors, synthetic minors, NESHAP Part 61 minors, minors with an unresolved High Priority Violation (HPV), with recent enforcement actions, or included on a Compliance Monitoring Strategy plan. The Clean Air Act requires that delegated agencies and EPA track all federally reportable sources in Air Facility System (AFS).
* For CWA  = Each CWA Source ID or National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit is defined by the program office as a Major or Minor discharger.
* For RCRA = RCRA Source ID or permits for Treatment, Storage and Disposal facilities are identified by TSD, Large Quantity Generators are identified by LQG. Other values include Permit Workload (PMT), Closure Workload (CLO), Small Quantity Generator Universe (SQG), Conditionally-Exempt Small Quantity Generator (CESQG), Post-Closure Workload (POST CL), and Transporters.

property.Zip.title: Zip
property.Zip.description: US postal ZIP code, as maintained by ICIS.

rb.callback.title: callback
rb.callback.description: JSONP Callback.  For use with JSONP and GEOJSONP output only.  Enter a name of the function in which to wrap the JSON response.

rb.nn2.title: nn2
rb.nn2.description: Secondary statute filter, provide a single statute code to filter permit results (e.g., "EP313")

rb.nnn.title: nnn
rb.nnn.description: Statute filter, provide a single statute code to filter permit results (e.g., "CAA")

rb.output.title: output
rb.output.description:
Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
* JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
* JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
* XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.

rb.p_id.CAA.title: p_id
rb.p_id.CAA.description: EPA Facility Registry Service's REGISTRY_ID. A unique identifier for a facility across EPA program databases.

rb.p_units.title: p_units
rb.p_units.description: Units of Measurement.  For the Air Pollutant Report, the default value is 'lbs'.  Enter "TWPE" for Toxic Weighted Pounds Equivalents (TWPE).

caa_poll_rpt_rest_services.get_aggregate.description: Returns an object that includes aggregate emissions.

caa_poll_rpt_rest_services.get_air_quali.description: Returns an object that includes information on air quality.

caa_poll_rpt_rest_services.get_caapr.def.description: Returns a complex object (Air Pollutant Report) composed of objects from all of the other procedures.

caa_poll_rpt_rest_services.get_map.defau.description: Returns an object that includes information for displaying a map.

caa_poll_rpt_rest_services.get_nnnPermit.description: Returns an object that includes an array of permits.

caa_poll_rpt_rest_services.get_spatial_m.description: Returns an object that includes spatial metadata.
